settings.title: Record Store Day
settings.content: A month-long celebration shining a light on whiskey made from rye, the unsung hero of the whiskey world.

settings.title: What is Rye July?
settings.content:
Talk to anyone about whiskey and the conversation is usually dominated by age or provenance, rather than the base ingredient from which it’s made. Just like the variety of grapes in wine, whiskey can be made from a variety of grains - rye, wheat, barley, corn - all of which produce distinct flavours and expressions.

Rye July is a month-long celebration shining a light on whiskey made from rye, the unsung hero of the whiskey world.

settings.title: The beauty of Rye
settings.content:
The Gospel is crafted and distilled from 100% Australian unmalted rye, which has been cultivated and nurtured by a single farmer in the Murray Mallee region of South Australia.

Specifically chosen for its harsh climate, the rye from this area is small and dense – renowned for its distinct, extraordinary flavour and is unmatched by rye from other areas.

It imparts deep, spicy flavours of vanilla, cinnamon and dried fruit, with developing notes of pepper, grass and grain.

settings.title: On the Journal
settings.content: As part of Record Store Day, we spoke to Lachlan Stuckey from Surprise Chef about his passion for vinyl.

settings.title: Go Dry This Rye July
settings.content:
As Australia’s only dedicated rye whiskey distillery, we set out to create a non-alcoholic alternative that was inclusive of all.

Under the guidance of qualified Sommelier and R&D Distiller Ellie Ash, Responsible Rye spent over a year in development - a commitment to flavour and perfecting the recipe without compromise.

Responsible Rye is available to purchase here.

settings.title: Rye July events
settings.content:
Join us throughout the month of July and help us celebrate the hardy and determined rye grain.

We've packed the month with innovative new releases and worked with collaborative partners and our friends behind the bar to craft some incredible rye whiskey experiences.

Join a masterclass, a food & whiskey experience or take a distillery tour – there’s a curated event to suit everyone this Rye July.

Download the events calendar here.

settings.title: Rye July events in NSW
settings.content:
We'll be heading to Sydney for some of our biggest events to date.

We'd love for our Northerner rye whiskey fanatics to join us in celebratating Rye July. You'll find us here:

-- 13 July – (Aria Restaurant) – TBC
-- 14 July – (Bar Planet) – TBC
-- 15 & 16 July – Whisky Live
-- 17 July – Poor Tom’s Whiskey Hall – joint masterclass with gin and whiskey cocktails

settings.title: A Missing Ingredient
settings.content:
Pinot Noir Vermouth is made in collaboration with local urban winery Noisy Ritual. A robust barrel-rested vermouth, it complements The Gospel Rye Whiskey while highlighting the purity of the Noisy Ritual Pinot Noir fruit. It’s aromatic with density of fruit and a balance of bitterness on the palate.

An essential ingredient for mixing with The Gospel rye whiskey in a Manhattan or simply enjoy on the rocks.

Pinot Noir Vermouth is available to purchase here.
